definition: to set off firecrackers
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)
to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
variant of 炮[pao4]
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating
cannon/CL:座[zuo4]/firecracker
to set off fire crackers

sentences.english: The villagers beat drums and lit firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 村民们敲锣打鼓放鞭炮。

sentences.english: Third, set off firecrackers and the customs temporary enduring a tradition.
sentences.chinese: 第三，放鞭炮也是我国习俗傍边经久不衰的一项传统。

sentences.english: Many boys explode firecrackers on the Lantern Festival everyyear。
sentences.chinese: 许多男孩子每年在灯节放鞭炮。

sentences.english: They set off firecrackers and watch fireworks displays。
I wanted to set off fireworks, but XiaoLing stopped me.
sentences.chinese: 我想要放鞭炮，但是晓玲组织了我。

sentences.english: We go out to see a lion and and set off some fireworks.
sentences.chinese: 我们出去看看舞龙狮和放鞭炮。

sentences.english: On the Eve of Chinese New Year, supper is a feast with families. The family will end the night with firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 除夕夜，家人会一起吃年夜饭，过年时会放鞭炮。

sentences.english: We also enjoy making loud noise with firecrackers!
sentences.chinese: 我们也喜欢伴随著吵杂的声音燃放鞭炮。

sentences.english: Tell jokes to each other, we play games, set off firecrackers and charade, etc.
sentences.chinese: 我们互相讲笑话，玩游戏，放鞭炮，猜字谜等。

sentences.english: Neither eat dinner, nor to set off firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 既没有吃上大餐，也没有放鞭炮。

sentences.english: In Guangzhou, people celebrate this festival by riding the dragon boat and lighting firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 在广州，人们用乘坐龙舟和放鞭炮来庆祝这个节日。

sentences.english: The teenagers like to let off firecrackers.
Other activities include lighting firecrackers and giving money in red paper envelopes.
sentences.chinese: 其他活动包括放鞭炮，还有发红包。

sentences.english: It's time to abandon the old, bad social traditions and prohibit the firecrackers.
sentences.chinese: 该是移风易俗，禁放鞭炮的时候了。

sentences.english: In many places people like to set off firecrackers, Dumplings are the most traditional food.
sentences.chinese: 在很多地方，人们都会放鞭炮，饺子是最传统的食物。

sentences.english: I wanted to set off fireworks, but Ling stopped me.
sentences.chinese: 我想要放鞭炮，但是晓玲组织了我。

firecrackers/string of small firecrackers/CL:枚[mei2]

firecracker

firecracker

to see in the New Year/to stay up all night on lunar New Year's Eve
firecrackers set off at the stroke of midnight on New Year's Day (a Chinese tradition)
last day of the lunar year/Chinese New Year's Eve
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
last day of the lunar year/Chinese New Year's Eve
to burn paper offerings (as part of religious ceremony)
(of a family) to come together at lunar New Year's Eve/family reunion at New Year's
to pay a New Year call/to wish sb a Happy New Year
lunar New Year's Eve
